alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:42PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of east central Lincoln and southwestern Spokane Counties through 600 PM PDT... At 531 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers 7 miles southwest of Medical Lake, or 10 miles west of Cheney, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheney, Airway Heights, Medical Lake, Fairchild AFB, Four Lakes, and Waukon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 258 and 275. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 277 and 280. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
